Description: U.K.-based British Airways PLC and South Korean-based Korean Air Lines Co. Ltd. each agreed to plead guilty and pay separate $300 million criminal fines for their roles in conspiracies to fix the prices of passenger and cargo flights.

Agency: Transportation Department Aviation Consumer Protection Division
Transportation Department Aviation Consumer Protection Division

Description: South Korea-based companies SK Energy Co. Ltd., GS Caltex Corporation, and Hanjin Transportation Co. Ltd. agreed to pay a total of $154 million to resolve civil antitrust and False Claims Act allegations relating to a decade-long bid-rigging conspiracy that targeted contracts to supply fuel to United States Army, Navy, Marine Corps, and Air Force bases in South Korea. They separately settled related criminal charges.
